Core#

Content extraction from PDFs.

Text#

class papercutter.core.text.TextExtractor[source]#

Extract and process text from PDFs.

__init__(backend)[source]#

Initialize with an extraction backend.

Parameters:

backend (Extractor) – PDF extraction backend (e.g., PdfPlumberExtractor).

extract(path, pages=None)[source]#

Extract full text from PDF.

Parameters:

  • path (Path) – Path to the PDF file.

  • pages (Optional[list[int]]) – Optional list of 0-indexed page numbers.

Return type:

str

Returns:

Extracted text as a string.

extract_chunked(path, chunk_size=4000, overlap=200, pages=None)[source]#

Extract text as overlapping chunks for LLM processing.

Uses character-based chunking with sentence boundary awareness.

Parameters:

  • path (Path) – Path to the PDF file.

  • chunk_size (int) – Target size of each chunk in characters.

  • overlap (int) – Number of characters to overlap between chunks.

  • pages (Optional[list[int]]) – Optional list of 0-indexed page numbers.

Return type:

list[str]

Returns:

List of text chunks.

FIGURE_PATTERNS = [re.compile('Figure\\s+(\\d+(?:\\.\\d+)?)', re.IGNORECASE), re.compile('Fig\\.\\s*(\\d+(?:\\.\\d+)?)', re.IGNORECASE), re.compile('Figs?\\.\\s*(\\d+(?:\\s*[-–]\\s*\\d+)?)', re.IGNORECASE)]#
TABLE_PATTERNS = [re.compile('Table\\s+(\\d+(?:\\.\\d+)?)', re.IGNORECASE), re.compile('Tab\\.\\s*(\\d+(?:\\.\\d+)?)', re.IGNORECASE)]#
extract_chunked_with_metadata(path, chunk_size=4000, overlap=200, pages=None, sections=None, detect_references=True)[source]#

Extract text as chunks with rich metadata for LLM processing.

Parameters:

  • path (Path) – Path to the PDF file.

  • chunk_size (int) – Target size of each chunk in characters.

  • overlap (int) – Number of characters to overlap between chunks.

  • pages (Optional[list[int]]) – Optional list of 0-indexed page numbers.

  • sections (Optional[list]) – Optional section info from DocumentIndexer.

  • detect_references (bool) – Whether to scan for figure/table references.

Return type:

list[TextChunk]

Returns:

List of TextChunk objects with metadata.

Tables#

class papercutter.core.tables.ExtractedTable[source]#

Represents an extracted table from a PDF.

page: int#
data: list[list[str]]#
bbox: Optional[tuple[float, float, float, float]] = None#
property rows: int#

Number of rows in the table.

property cols: int#

Number of columns in the table.

property headers: list[str]#

Get the first row as headers.

to_csv()[source]#

Convert table to CSV string.

Return type:

str

Returns:

CSV formatted string.

to_json()[source]#

Convert table to JSON string.

Return type:

str

Returns:

JSON formatted string with table data.

to_dict_rows()[source]#

Convert table to list of dictionaries using first row as headers.

Return type:

list[dict[str, str]]

Returns:

List of row dictionaries.

__init__(page, data, bbox=None)#
Parameters:

  • page (int)

  • data (list[list[str]])

  • bbox (tuple[float, float, float, float] | None)

Return type:

None

class papercutter.core.tables.TableExtractor[source]#

Extract tables from PDFs.

__init__(backend)[source]#

Initialize with an extraction backend.

Parameters:

backend (Extractor) – PDF extraction backend (e.g., PdfPlumberExtractor).

extract(path, pages=None)[source]#

Extract all tables from PDF.

Parameters:

  • path (Path) – Path to the PDF file.

  • pages (Optional[list[int]]) – Optional list of 0-indexed page numbers.

Return type:

list[ExtractedTable]

Returns:

List of ExtractedTable objects.

extract_as_csv(path, pages=None)[source]#

Extract all tables as CSV strings.

Parameters:

  • path (Path) – Path to the PDF file.

  • pages (Optional[list[int]]) – Optional list of 0-indexed page numbers.

Return type:

list[tuple[int, str]]

Returns:

List of (page_number, csv_string) tuples.

References#

class papercutter.core.references.Reference[source]#

Represents a parsed reference/citation.

raw_text: str#
title: Optional[str] = None#
authors: list[str]#
year: Optional[int] = None#
journal: Optional[str] = None#
volume: Optional[str] = None#
pages: Optional[str] = None#
doi: Optional[str] = None#
url: Optional[str] = None#
to_bibtex()[source]#

Convert reference to BibTeX format.

Return type:

str

Returns:

BibTeX entry string.

to_dict()[source]#

Convert reference to dictionary.

Return type:

dict[str, Any]

Returns:

Dictionary representation.

__init__(raw_text, title=None, authors=<factory>, year=None, journal=None, volume=None, pages=None, doi=None, url=None)#
Parameters:

  • raw_text (str)

  • title (str | None)

  • authors (list[str])

  • year (int | None)

  • journal (str | None)

  • volume (str | None)

  • pages (str | None)

  • doi (str | None)

  • url (str | None)

Return type:

None

class papercutter.core.references.ReferenceExtractor[source]#

Extract references from PDFs.

SECTION_PATTERNS = ['(?i)^references?\\s*$', '(?i)^bibliography\\s*$', '(?i)^works?\\s+cited\\s*$', '(?i)^literature\\s+cited\\s*$']#
DOI_PATTERN = re.compile('10\\.\\d{4,9}/[^\\s\\])<>,;\'\\"]+(?<![.,;:)])')#
YEAR_PATTERN = re.compile('\\b(19|20)\\d{2}\\b')#
PAGES_PATTERN = re.compile('\\b(\\d+)\\s*[-–—]\\s*(\\d+)\\b')#
__init__(backend)[source]#

Initialize with an extraction backend.

Parameters:

backend (Extractor) – PDF extraction backend.

extract(path)[source]#

Extract references from PDF.

Parameters:

path (Path) – Path to the PDF file.

Return type:

list[Reference]

Returns:

List of Reference objects.

An extracted figure from a PDF.

caption: Optional[str] = None#

Save figure to file.

Parameters:

output_path (Path) – Output file path.

Return type:

Path

Returns:

Path to saved file.

Convert to dictionary (without image data).

Return type:

dict

  • width (int)

Return type:

None

class papercutter.core.figures.FigureExtractor[source]#

Extract figures/images from PDF files.

Uses PyMuPDF (fitz) for image extraction. Falls back gracefully if not installed.

MIN_WIDTH = 100#
MIN_HEIGHT = 100#
__init__(min_width=100, min_height=100)[source]#

Initialize the figure extractor.

Parameters:

  • min_width (int) – Minimum width for figures.

  • min_height (int) – Minimum height for figures.

extract(pdf_path, pages=None)[source]#

Extract figures from a PDF.

Parameters:

  • pdf_path (Path) – Path to PDF file.

  • pages (Optional[list[int]]) – Optional list of 0-indexed page numbers.

Return type:

list[ExtractedFigure]

Returns:

List of extracted figures.

Raises:

ImportError – If PyMuPDF is not installed.

extract_one(pdf_path, figure_id)[source]#

Extract a single figure by ID.

Parameters:

  • pdf_path (Path) – Path to PDF file.

  • figure_id (int) – Figure ID (1-indexed).

Return type:

Optional[ExtractedFigure]

Returns:

ExtractedFigure or None if not found.

is_available()[source]#

Check if figure extraction is available.

Return type:

bool
